text: Clackmannanshire is a county and a council area in Scotland. It lies north of the River Forth, between Perthshire to the north and Fife to the south.Shennan, Hay 1892. Boundaries of counties and parishes in Scotland as settled by the Boundary Commissioners under the Local Government (Scotland) Act 1889. Edinburgh: W. Green. p. 271. Retrieved 19 April 2023. Clackmannanshire is the smallest county in the United Kingdom. Some villages/places in the county: Clackmannan, Alloa, Dollar, Tillicoultry, Tullibody. == References == Category:Scottish Council Areas Category:Counties of Scotland Category:British shires
title: Clackmannanshire
